channel.title: Data Quality on Vitthal Mirji
channel.description: Recent content in Data Quality on Vitthal Mirji

item.title: DQ Is Not Dairy Queen: Building My Own Data Quality Framework
item.description:
🍦 DQ ≠ Ice Cream

When someone hears “DQ Framework,” I get asked if it comes with sprinkles. It doesn’t. It comes with sanity-saving data validations, automatable quality checks, and opinionated constraints that don’t melt under pressure.

So no, this isn’t about Dairy Queen. But it does prevent frozen pipelines. ❄️

💡 Why I Built It

Every data engineer has been there:

  • A critical job runs on time… and writes garbage.
  • Downstream dashboards look suspiciously optimistic.
  • Stakeholders smile because they don’t know 18% of yesterday’s rows are NULL.

I couldn’t keep slapping WHERE col IS NOT NULL forever. So I built a reusable, testable Data Quality Framework ( DQF) and paired it with a Declarative Pipeline Assurance Tool (DPAT).

item.title: How I Cut Delivery Errors by 82% Without Losing My Sanity
item.description:
🚨 The Problem: Errors Everywhere

At my organization, we were shipping data pipelines faster than ever—but the delivery error rate stayed stubbornly around 12%, which meant:

  • 😓 Manual rollbacks, dashboards showing stale or missing data
  • 👎 Frustrated teams notifying stakeholders (and me) daily
  • 🕒 A few hours lost per incident, every day

It wasn’t sustainable—and I’d had enough.

🎯 The Goal

Implement a self-healing pipeline with:

  • Automated quality gates
  • Full pipeline rollback on failure
  • Clear ownership via data contracts
  • Faster failed-job detection

And yes, keep my sanity intact.

item.title: Don’t trust the dashboard: How I rewired Data monitoring from the ground up
item.description: 🚨 Hook: “Because dashboards lie. And I sleep better now.”
